derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin miscellaneus (from miscellus 'mixed', from miscere 'to mix') + -ous. In earlier use the word also described a person as 'having various qualities'

entry.tran: 混杂的;五花八门的;各式各样的
entry.def: A miscellaneous group consists of many different kinds of things or people that are difficult to put into a particular category.

example.tran: 收藏的一堆乱七八糟的破烂

example.ex: They eat a lot of meats and dairy foods, along with a lot of miscellaneous items that don't fall into any group.
example.tran: 他们吃了大量的肉和奶制品，还有许多不知道该归为什么类别的杂七杂八的东西。

means.word_mean: 2. consisting of a haphazard assortment of different kinds (even to the point of incongruity);

sentences.sentence: "a mixed program of baroque and contemporary music"
"sundry sciences commonly known as social"- I.A.Richards

stems_affixes.word_buile: miscell=misc混淆+aneous多……的→adj.多种的,混杂的
im不+miscible[adj.易混合的]→adj.不能混合的;不融洽的
pro多+misc混淆+uous……的→很多混合在一起→杂乱的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 不混合的,不容易混合的
stems_affixes.word_buile: non不+miscible[adj.易混合的]→adj.不混合的,不容易混合的
pro多+misc混淆+uity=ity表名词→很多混合在一起
extempore即席的,当场的+aneous多……的,……特征的→即席,当场
miscell=misc混淆+aneous多……的→adj.多种的,混杂的
simult类似+aneous多……的,……特征的→时间相同的
spont=spond+aneous多……的,……特征的→自内心的承诺

means.word_mean: 不同种类的,多种多样的;混杂的
